content.text: Topic: 5.2.1 Autotrophic Nutrition
What is Photosynthesis?
Photosynthesis is the process where autotrophs take simple things from the outside world and turn them into stored energy (food!).
The Ingredients for Photosynthesis
Plants take in two main things from the environment:
Carbon Dioxide (CO₂) – from the air we breathe out
Water (H₂O) – from the soil
Absorption of Light Energy by Chlorophyll
subBullets: Chlorophyll absorbs sunlight like a tiny solar panel

content.text: Getting Carbon Dioxide (CO₂)
Plants get carbon dioxide from the air through tiny pores on the surface of leaves called stomata.
Opening and closing of stomata is regulated by guard cells.
Plants take in two main things from the environment:
Carbon Dioxide (CO₂) – from the air we breathe out
Water (H₂O) – from the soil
Absorption of Light Energy by Chlorophyll
